clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Education for Harm Reduction in Patients With Alcohol Use Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Therapeutic Education Program for Harm Reduction in Patients With Alcohol Use Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock:
Alcohol is the most harmful psychoactive substance in terms of overall damage. Though abstinence remains the objective of most pharmacological and non-pharmacological approaches addressing alcohol use disorder, new therapeutic objectives of reduced alcohol intake and controlled-drinking have emerged. A standardized 10 weeks long, the "ChoiziTaConso" (CTC) therapeutic education program consisting in weekly workshops is one such non-pharmacological intervention that targets the recovery of conscious protective mechanisms with respect to alcohol use. The objective of our study is to measure the effectiveness of this non-pharmacological intervention in reducing alcohol-related harms.
The evaluation of the CTC intervention will rely on a sequential explanatory design, where the qualitative study (25 semi-structured interviews) will assist in explaining and interpreting the findings of the controlled before-and-after quantitative study. The evolution of selected outcomes will be compared after 6 months between the treatment group (individuals entering CTC) and the control group (individuals with alcohol use disorder followed-up in standard addiction healthcare facilities).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group.
primary_outcome.description: Composite score with 10 dimensions (Alcohol consumption, Direct consequences of alcohol use, Craving, Quality of life, Capability measure, Social functioning, Stigmatization, Anxiety & Depression, Neurological functioning, Coping Strategies).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: A validated measure of physical and mental health
Frequency and quantity of alcohol use
Consumption of at least 4 (women), or 6 (men) alcoholic drinks in one setting

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: 29 questions on social, work and family aspects that can be impacted by alcohol use

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported control over alcohol consumption, and feelings related to alcohol (13 questions)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: 6 questions on isolation, and relationships with family, friends and healthcare professionals

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: 11 questions on expected stigmatisation by others and self-stigmatisation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: HAD anxiety and depressive symptoms scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: The Brief Evaluation of Alcohol-Related Neuropsychological Impairment (BEARNI) test is a clinical screening tool.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relation between alcohol consumption and harm reduction criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: 28 questions on strategies used to cope with difficult or stressful events (COPE questionnaire)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Compared after 6 months between treatment group and control group
secondary_outcome.description: 5 questions on current perceived ability with respect to attachment, stability, achievement, enjoyment and autonomy

arm_group.description: Patients that followed the therapeutic education program that will be interviewed (semi-directed interviews).

Administration of socio-economic questionnaires and of the neurological BEARNi test (Brief Evaluation of Alcohol-Related Neuropsychological Impairment test) before, and 6 months after inclusion in the therapeutic education program.
Administration of socio-economic questionnaires and of the neurological BEARNi test twice with a 6 months interval.

intervention.description: The "ChoiziTaConso" therapeutic education program consists in 10 standardized weekly group workshops that target the recovery of conscious protective mechanisms with respect to alcohol use.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consist in adults with alcohol use disorder eligible to participate to a therapeutic education program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years old or older
- Fluent in French
- Informed consent
- Followed-up for Alcohol Use Disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dependency to opioids or cocaine
- Adult under guardianship
- Pregnancy
- Participation in another study during the duration of follow-up (6 months)
- Cognitive disorder and/or psychiatric disorder recommending against teamwork
